Note: Participant is unsure whether they have started recording aside from the initial noise heard when starting video recording
Participant does not notice led flashing in corner of eye when recording video through glasses
Participant decides that recording with MR glasses is easier because they can tell how long they’ve been recording and when they’ve started
Participant notices that Gen2 glasses feel more snug which leads to less adjustments made
Participant expresses desire to take comfort if Gen2 glasses and combine it with capabilities of MR glasses
Participant notices that Meta still pronounces names wrong when confirming message sending request
Participant believes that side touch panel is responsive as long as users know where touch pad is located on the arm of glasses
After viewing images on phone, participant deduces that capturing images requires intentional placement of object in front of glasses to capture expected perspective
Participant notices that images did not necessarily match expected perspective and objects veered off to side
Participant captured more images and successfully captured objects in the middle instead of on the side
Participant’s inclination was to test camera quality by capturing image of embossed design on cup and bowl. Participant expressed contentment with camera performance after viewing images
Participant notices that camera was able to capture different textures under different lighting
Participant is happy with clarity of lenses and does not notice any glare
Participant says that sometimes they forget glasses are on their face and feel very lightweight despite not being used to wearing glasses
Participant decides that MR glasses feel more like VR glasses whereas they can imagine that Gen2 glasses feel more like what regular glasses would feel like
Participant notices that Meta responses are more straightforward, stating “this Meta does not play around”
Participant notices that Meta in Gen2 glasses features a different tone, describing the tone as more “sure” about responses when asking for more information about books and other searchable content

Participant notices that this Meta sounds like it has an “attitude”, describing it as thorough and accurate. Says that people with learning disabilities like them could benefit from the details provided by Meta responses which extend beyond expected responses
